title: Anyone else have their ping double since patch 6.14?
body:
So since the servers moved, I normally chill at 32ping, doesn't really change.  However since patch 6.14 (I t hink?) I have noticed i sit at 62ping. 
Am I an idiot and missed the memo ping was changing agian?
Did i do something? and can I fix it?
Haven't really changed anything recently that i can think of... rito Halp D:

replies.body:
Since patches deal with only local files inside of your League directory, they're *extremely unlikely* to cause any changes in your latency (ping). Most changes in latency are caused by routing changes at an ISP for specific traffic to that server or service. Sometimes local settings can influence your latency as well, so going through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) isn't a bad starting point in troubleshooting this issue.

Let me know if this guide helps you with your connection.

Ok so i did work tech support for a year for my ISP so i know enough to do things, but I also know enough to be aware I really have no idea what I'm doing, if that makes sense. 

With that said...

I'm using a wired connection

firewall is Microsoft Security Essentials, added an exception or whatever for League of Legends

Public DNS didn't change anything so i reverted to automatic

http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ wouldn't work in chrome, did it in Firefox, has me lost though. I ran it and I can see my results, not a clue what it means, I can link it to you, unsure if I should do that publicly or not.

Packet buffering had the same link as packet loss as far as I could tell so see above

I don't use a VPN or a Poxy

ipconfig /release ipconfig /renew ipconfig /flushdns was all done as administrator.

did a ping test for shits and giggles [you can find it here](http://www.pingtest.net/result/149382772.png)

Ping is still 62-64 :( RIP -> Edited for formatting

Since you're still having issues, we'll need to investigate deeper into your network configuration and route to the server. To do this, we'll need you to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and attach the link to your [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1) and a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)

Let me know if you have additional questions.
I haven't had enough time to submit a ticket, however I played my first game on patch 6.15 and it seems my ping has returned to normal.

Yes. I've had a ridiculous spike in ping both on my account and my boyfriends. We've tried EVERYRHING. Our internet works fine on both the laptop with browsers open, streaming videos, and on multiple tablets and smartphones, but LoL lags? It's definitely not our internet and I've seen multiple posts stating the same concept. It worked fine last patch, but it's obviously our fault and we have to troubleshoot the issue even though it doesn't fix it.
